title: Research
text:
Publications
Bohan Li and Timothy J. Layton. (2025). Medicaid Managed Care: Substantial Shifts In Market Landscape And Acquisitions, 2006-20. Health Affairs. 44 (7): 862-868.
Work in Progress
Does ownership matter? Evidence from urgent care clinics (with David Cutler and Robert S. Huckman)
Is management a shared corporate asset? Evidence from U.S. hospitals (with Robert S. Huckman, Raffaella Sadun, T. Kirk White and Alice Zawacki)
Physician Practice Acquisitions and Medicaid Enrollee Outcomes (with Ambar La Forgia and Becky Staiger)

title: Bohan Li
text:
Hello! My name is Bohan. Iâ€™m a PhD Candidate in Health Policy Management at Harvard Business School. My research interests are at the intersection of health economics, management and organizational economics. My current work focuses on issues of ownership in the U.S. healthcare, spanning providers and payers.
Prior to graduate school, I worked as a management consultant in New York City. I earned my BA from the University of Pennsylvania in chemistry and economics.
